textSection.textSectionContent:
A number sign (#) is used with this entry because of evidence that susceptibility to age-related macular degeneration-5 is conferred by heterozygous mutation in the ERCC6 gene ({609413}) on chromosome 10q11.

For a phenotypic description and a discussion of genetic heterogeneity of age-related macular degeneration, see {603075}.

In a cohort of 460 advanced cases of age-related macular degeneration and 269 age-matched controls and 57 archived ARMD cases and 18 age-matched non-ARMD controls, {1:Tuo et al. (2006)} found that a -6530C-G SNP ({609413.0010}; {dbSNP rs3793784}) in the ERCC6 gene was associated with ARMD susceptibility, both independently and through interaction with an intronic SNP in the CFH gene (see {134370.0008}; {dbSNP rs380390}) previously reported to be highly associated with ARMD.

reference.authors: Tuo, J., Ning, B., Bojanowski, C. M., Lin, Z.-N., Ross, R. J., Reed, G. F., Shen, D., Jiao, X., Zhou, M., Chew, E. Y., Kadlubar, F. F., Chan, C.-C.
reference.title: Synergic effect of polymorphisms in ERCC6 5-prime flanking region and complement factor H on age-related macular degeneration predisposition.

phenotypeMap.geneSymbols: ERCC6, CKN2, COFS1, CSB, ARMD5, UVSS1
